section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: There is a contradiction between the renewal term and the termination clause. The agreement states that after the initial six-month term, it automatically renews for one-month periods unless either party provides a 15-day notice of non-renewal. However, it also states that either party can terminate the agreement 'without cause at any time' with a 30-day written notice. This contradicts the one-month renewal period. If a party gives a 30-day termination notice during a one-month renewal period, it effectively negates the purpose of the shorter renewal term. It creates ambiguity in how the agreement can be terminated.

section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: The clause concerning the term and termination of the agreement contains contradictory elements regarding the notice period required for non-renewal versus termination. The agreement stipulates that a 15-day notice is needed to prevent automatic renewal for an additional month, yet it also allows for termination 'without cause' with a 30-day notice. This creates a contradiction because if a party provides a 20-day notice, is that enough to terminate, or does the agreement automatically renew for 1 month? This conflict in notice periods introduces uncertainty and possible disputes regarding the actual termination date.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The subscriber is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The paragraph seems to have an issue with the naming of the customer. It refers to the customer in one sentence and then refers to the same customer as the subscriber. These terms should be clearly defined.
